page.title: 11 THE FLOOD SCHEME BRUTON.
page.content: The area around Bruton has suffered the effects of heavy and subsequent flooding for many years.Its position in a narrow valley naturally encourages floods,acting as a funnel for water from the hills.The 1982 flood served to emphasise the problems of the area. As a result a scheme to prevent the effects of serious flooding was suggested.By 1985 the flood prevention scheme was completed,having involved a fair degree of work and inconvenience including the closure of a main road out of Bruton,for several months. Essentially the water from the surrounding hills is collected out- side the settlement and then taken through Bruton,under the ground in a huge tunnel,several feet high and deposited in another collection point on the other side.As yet the scheme has not been fully tested:we await the day!
